Name: A public procurement interface.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a public procurement interface

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

History.Action: P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
This Introduction was Introduced by Council

Summary: This bill would require the City Chief Procurement Officer to ensure that one or more searchable, publicly accessible interfaces provide information about city procurements that exceed the small purchase limits. Such interface would need to provide information at key stages of the procurement process, including anticipated requirements prior to solicitation, solicitation summaries, contract award details, and total expenditures upon completion of the contract.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 1 of Title 6 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 6-151 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 6-151 Public procurement interface. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section:\par
Contract. The term "contract" \cf1 means any agreement, purchase order or instrument whereby an agency whose head is appointed by the mayor is committed to expend or does expend funds in return for goods, professional services, standard services, or construction.\par
\cf0 Procurement. The term "procurement" means the process by which an agency whose head is appointed by the mayor solicits and awards a contract.\par
b. The city chief procurement officer shall ensure that one or more searchable and publicly accessible interfaces provide information about each procurement that exceeds the small purchase limits established pursuant to section 314 of the Charter, including but not limited to the following types of information, where applicable, practicable and available:\par
1. a contracting process identifier; \par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj 2. the name and point of contact of the purchasing agency;\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 3. prior to a solicitation, a summary outlining the anticipated requirements of the procurement, to the extent such information is available, including:\par
(a) the purpose of the procurement;\par
(b) the anticipated procurement method;\par
(c) the proposed term of the contract;\par
(d) the anticipated procurement timelines, including, but not limited to, the anticipated start date for new contracts, anticipated solicitation release date, and approximate submission deadline for bids or proposals;\par
(e) the anticipated total funding available for the procurement and the anticipated number of contracts to be awarded, average funding level available for such contracts, and anticipated funding ranges per award, if applicable; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj (f) proposed vendor performance reporting requirements.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 4. upon publication of a solicitation document, a summary of such document, including: \par
(a) the procurement method; \par
(b) the industry of the procurement;\par
(c) a description in plain language of the scope of goods or services to be procured;\par
(d) the submission method and period for bids or proposals; \par
(e) the eligibility criteria; \par
(f) the evaluation and award criteria;\par
(g) the estimated start date and scheduled completion date of the contract; and\par
(h) the date of publication of any addendum to the solicitation document and the reason for such addendum.\par
5. upon award of a contract, a summary of such contract, including: \par
(a) the industry of the contract; \par
(b) the contractor\rquote s legal name;\par
(c) a description in plain language of the scope of goods or services to be provided pursuant to the contract; \par
(d) the method of award of the contract;\par
(e) the maximum expenditure authorized under the contract; and\par
(f) the start date and anticipated completion date of the contract. \par
6. upon completion of a contract or at periodic intervals determined by the city chief procurement officer, a summary of expenditures pursuant to such contract, including: \par
(a) the total amount expended during the contract term; and\par
(b) the legal names of any subcontractors utilized during the contract term, and the scope of work and value of each subcontract.\par
c. The city chief procurement officer may determine the format, structure, and organization of the interfaces to ensure compatibility with existing procurement systems and future technological upgrades. \par
d. Information required by this section shall be published in the appropriate interface within 10 business days of the occurrence of the relevant procurement event, except that information required by paragraph 3 of subdivision b shall be published no later than 30 days prior to the release of a solicitation document, to the extent such information is available. \par
e. The city chief procurement officer may withhold information otherwise required to be published by this section if publication of such information would compromise public safety, reveal confidential information, or interfere with a law enforcement investigation. \par
\pard\ltrpar\sl252\slmult1\qj\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.\ul\fs20 Session 14\par
